discussion.content:
C is Correct
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/horizon-installation/GUID-5F4A0BDE-4C61-43D6-8A88-524CE93224BF.html
Standard installation
Generates a Connection Server instance with a new View LDAP configuration.
Replica installation
Generates a Connection Server instance with a View LDAP configuration that is copied from an existing instance.
Security server installation
Generates a Connection Server instance that adds an additional layer of security between the Internet and your internal network.
Enrollment Server installation
Installs an enrollment server that is required for the True SSO (single sign-on) feature, so that after users log in to VMware Identity Manager, they can connect to a remote desktop or application without having to provide Active Directory credentials. The enrollment server requests the short-lived certificates that are used for authentication

questions.question_text: What location will verify the successful installation of vRealize Operations for VMware Horizon?

choices.D: vRealize Operation Manager log files on vCenter server

questions.question_text: What is the recommended relationship between View Composer servers and vCenter servers?

discussion.content:
"To use View Composer, you must configure settings that allow Horizon 7 to connect to the VMware Horizon View Composer service. View Composer can be installed on its own separate host or on the same host as vCenter Server.

There must be a one-to-one mapping between each VMware Horizon View Composer service and vCenter Server instance. A View Composer service can operate with only one vCenter Server instance. A vCenter Server instance can be associated with only one VMware Horizon View Composer service."

choices.B: One View Composer server to one vCenter server
choices.D: Many View Composer servers to one vCenter server
choices.A: Many View Composer servers to many vCenter servers
choices.C: One View Composer server to many vCenter servers

questions.question_text:
The VMware Horizon administrator is unable to configure View Storage Accelerator on a vSphere 6 desktop virtual machine.
What could be the reason?

choices.B: The virtual machine is on a VSAN datastore
choices.C: Global Policies has been edited and the Multimedia redirection (MMR) value has been set to Allow
choices.A: You cannot use View Storage Accelerator in a vSphere 5.5 or later environments
choices.D: The virtual machine is larger than 512GB

discussion.content:
Found on another question

To use View Storage Accelerator in a vSphere 5.5 or later environment, a desktop virtual machine must be 512GB or smaller.
View Storage Accelerator is disabled on virtual machines that are larger than 512GB.
Virtual machine size is defined by the total VMDK capacity. For example, one VMDK file might be 512GB or a set of VMDK files might total 512GB. This requirement also applies to virtual machines that were created in an earlier vSphere release and upgraded to vSphere 5.5.
